member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.AssemblyManagement.AssemblyResolver
member.summary: Allows runtime assembly resolution in current AppDomain in your application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.AssemblyManagement.AssemblyResolver.Init
member.summary: Initialize Assembly Resolver in the current domain on the current thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.AssemblyManagement.AssemblyResolver.Init(System.String[])
member.summary: Initialize Assembly Resolver in the current domain on the current thread.
member.param: Paths to search when resolving assemblies. These are added to the set of existing paths, defined in app config.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.AssemblyManagement.AssemblyResolver.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of AssemblyResolver that is attached to the current AppDomain. After constructing, call Init() to register the specified paths in assembly resolver to allow your application to find assemblies in the provided locations.
member.param: Paths where assemblies need to be searched for.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.AssemblyManagement.AssemblyResolver.HandleAssemblyResolve(System.Object,System.ResolveEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles AssemblyResolve events within Office build environment.
member.returns: object that resolves the assembly reference.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.AssemblyManagement.Extensions.AddQuoted(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.String},System.String)
member.summary:
Adds the specified string to the set, making it quoted.
For example: if item is 'one', it will be quoted as "one", then added to the set.
member.param: String which should be surrounded by quotes (") and added to the set.
